ResourceHeader.ResourceName: MMS-2 FPI DES Level-2 Fast electron moments (CDF)
ResourceHeader.Description: This dataset provides the moments of the electron distribution at the FAST cadence (4.5 s) computed from the full distribution function and corrected from a number of effects (including the spacecraft electrostatic potential). The dataset comprises the main moments: density, velocity vector, temperatures (and associated pressure tensor), and heat flux. They are provided in GSE frame. For more information on the FPI instruments, data set, and user guide, please see: MMS Science Data Center (https://lasp.colorado.edu/mms/sdc/public/datasets/fpi/) MMS FPI Data Users and Products Guide (https://lasp.colorado.edu/galaxy/display/MFDPG/MMS+FPI+Data+Users+and+Products+Guide) FPI Release Notes (https://lasp.colorado.edu/mms/sdc/public/datasets/fpi/mms-FPIReleaseNotes-220217.pdf)
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: FPI data, as a data set of the MMS-SMART data products, are open to all scientists and the public (Users). Users should contact the MMS-SMART Principal Investigator (PI) J. L. Burch and B. Giles the FPI Lead to consult on the appropriate use of instrument data. Users should acknowledge the sources of data used in all publications, presentations, and reports. Please send information on the use of these data to: PI: J. L. Burch [jburch@swri.edu] FPI Lead: B. Giles [barbara.giles@gsfc.nasa.gov] We suggest to add the following lines into the acknowledgments: The authors acknowledge NASA, CNES (Centre National d'Etudes Spatiales) and CNRS (Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique) for their support to the MMS/FPI team and the CDPP (Centre de Données de la Physique des Plasmas) for the distribution of the MMS/SCM data. and if PI/coI are not part of the publication list, then we suggest to add Specifically, we acknowledge J. L. Burch for use of data from the MMS-SMART mission, B. Giles for use of FPI data. For more informations about data rights and rules, see MMS Science Data center The following paper should also be used to reference: Pollock, C., T. Moore, A. Jacques, J. Burch, U. Gliese, Y. Rodriguez, J. Rouzaud, A. Rucker, Y. Saito, M. Samara, J.-A. Sauvaud, D. Schuster, M. Shappirio, K. Shelton, D. Sher, D. Smith, K. Smith, S. Smith, D. Steinfeld, R. Szymkiewicz, K. Tanimoto, J. Parameter.Name: Data Quality Error Flags
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES dataQuality errorFlags
Parameter.Caveats: A Value of Zero signifies no Quality Errors. For Non-Zero Values: Bit-0=Manually flagged Interval, Bit-1=Overcounting/Saturation Effects likely present in Sky Map, Bit-2=Reported Spacecraft Potential above 20 V, Bit-3=Invalid/Unavailable Spacecraft Potential, Bit-4=Significant (>10%) Cold Plasma (<10 eV) Component, Bit-5=Significant (>25%) Hot Plasma (>30 keV) Component, Bit-6=High Sonic Mach Number (V/Vth > 2.5), Bit-7=Low calculated Density (N_DES < 0.05 cm^-3), Bit-8=Bent Pipe Magnetic Field used instead of Survey l2pre Magnetic Field, Bit-10=No internally generated Photoelectron Correction applied, Bit-11=Compression Pipeline Error, Bit-12=Spintone Calculation Error (DBCS only)

Parameter.Name: Compression Flag
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES Compression Lossless/Lossy Indicator Flag at Survey Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: Compression Loss Indicator, 0=Lossless, 1=Lossy

Parameter.Name: Start Del-Phi Count
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES Del-Phi (obs spin-phase) count at survey-start time
Parameter.Caveats: Nominally, the Spin Phase Counts range over [0000,5759] Counts. Each Count represents 1/16 of a Degree (0.0625°) of Observatory Spin Phase. Zero Spin Phase Angle indicates that the Observatory +X-axis is aligned with the Sun Sensor Axis.

Parameter.Name: Start Del-Phi Angle
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES Del-Phi (obs spin-phase) angle at survey-start time
Parameter.Caveats: Nominally, the Spin Phase Angles range over [0°,360°). Each Count represents 1/16 of a Degree (0.0625°) of Observatory Spin Phase. Zero Spin Phase Angle indicates that the Observatory +X-axis is aligned with the Sun Sensor Axis.

Parameter.Name: Electron Pitch Angle Distribution, Low Energies
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron pitch-angle distribution for low energies during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: Low Energy Bin: Energy Steps 00-10 (of Total Steps 00-31). Pitch Angle Bin Size: 6°. Note that the Pitch Angles are calculated in the Spacecraft Frame. Thus, these Angles are not shifted by the Bulk Velocity.

Parameter.Name: Electron Pitch Angle Distribution, Mid Energies
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron pitch-angle distribution for mid energies during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: Mid Energy Bin: Energy Steps 11-20 (of Total Steps 00-31). Pitch Angle Bin Size: 6°. Note that the Pitch Angles are calculated in the Spacecraft Frame. Thus, these Angles are not shifted by the Bulk Velocity.

Parameter.Name: Electron Pitch Angle Distribution, High Energies
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron pitch-angle distribution for high energies during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: High Energy Bin: Energy Steps 21-31 (of Total Steps 00-31). Pitch Angle Bin Size: 6°. Note that the Pitch Angles are calculated in the Spacecraft Frame. Thus, these Angles are not shifted by the Bulk Velocity.

Parameter.Name: Electron Energy Spectrum, DBCS +X Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron energy spectrum near +X_DBCS during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the +X Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 45° ≤ Theta < 135° and 135° ≤ Phi < 225°).

Parameter.Name: Electron Energy Spectrum, DBCS -X Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron energy spectrum near X_DBCS during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the -X Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 45° ≤ Theta < 135° and Phi ≥ 315° or Phi < 45°).

Parameter.Name: Electron Energy Spectrum, DBCS +Y Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron energy spectrum near +Y_DBCS during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the +Y Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 45° ≤ Theta < 135° and 225° ≤ Phi < 315°). </Caveats>

Parameter.Name: Electron Energy Spectrum, DBCS -Y Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron energy spectrum near Y_DBCS during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the -Y Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 45° ≤ Theta < 135° and 45° ≤ Phi < 135°).

Parameter.Name: Electron Energy Spectrum, DBCS +Z Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron energy spectrum near +Z_DBCS during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the +Z Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 135° ≤ Theta < 180° and 0° ≤ Phi < 360°).

Parameter.Name: Electron Energy Spectrum, DBCS -Z Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron energy spectrum near Z_DBCS during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the -Z Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 0° ≤ Theta < 45° and 0° ≤ Phi < 360°).

Parameter.Name: Electron Energy Spectrum, B Parallel Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron energy parallel to the magnetic field direction during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction (not Instrument Look Direction) is within 30° of the Magnetic Field Direction.

Parameter.Name: Electron Energy Spectrum, B Anti-Parallel Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron energy anti-parallel to the magnetic field direction during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction (not Instrument Look Direction) is within 150° of the Magnetic Field Direction.

Parameter.Name: Electron Energy Spectrum, B Perpendicular Direction
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron energy perpendicular to the magnetic field direction during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction (not Instrument Look Direction) is within 60° to 120° of the Magnetic Field Direction.

Parameter.Name: Electron Energy Spectrum, Omni-Directional
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES omni-directional electron energy spectrum during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over all Directions (Flow or Look).

Parameter.Name: Electron Number Density
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron number density during this survey

Parameter.Name: Electron Number Density, Error
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron number density error during this survey

Parameter.Name: Electron Number Density, Extrapolation, Low
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES estimated (via extrapolation to 0) contribution to density integral below 10eV

Parameter.Name: Electron Number Density, Extrapolation, High
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES estimated (via extrapolation to infinity) contribution to density integral above 30keV

Parameter.Name: Electron Bulk Velocity Vector, DBCS
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron bulk-velocity vector in De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System during this survey

Parameter.Name: Electron Bulk Velocity Spintone Vector, DBCS
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron bulk-velocity estimated spintone vector in De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System during this survey

Parameter.Name: Electron Bulk Velocity Vector, GSE
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron bulk-velocity vector in GSE during this survey

Parameter.Name: Electron Bulk Velocity Spintone Vector, GSE
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron bulk-velocity estimated spintone vector in GSE during this survey

Parameter.Name: Electron Bulk Velocity Error Vector
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron bulk-velocity error vector during this survey

Parameter.Name: Electron Pressure Tensor, DBCS
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron pressure tensor in De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: The 3⨯3 Matrix is represented as: Row 1: Pxx Pxy Pxz, Row 2: Pyx Pyy Pyz, Row 3: Pzx Pzy Pzz. Note that Pij=Pji.

Parameter.Name: Electron Pressure Tensor, GSE
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron pressure tensor in GSE during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: The 3⨯3 Matrix is represented as: Row 1: Pxx Pxy Pxz, Row 2: Pyx Pyy Pyz, Row 3: Pzx Pzy Pzz. Note that Pij=Pji.

Parameter.Name: Electron Pressure Tensor, Error
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron pressure tensor error during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: The Error can be applied to Data expressed by using either DBCS or GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Electron Temperature Tensor, DBCS
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron temperature tensor in De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: The 3⨯3 Matrix is represented as: Row 1: Txx Txy Txz, Row 2: Tyx Tyy Tyz, Row 3: Tzx Tzy Tzz. Note that Tij=Tji.

Parameter.Name: Electron Temperature Tensor, GSE
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron temperature tensor in GSE during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: The 3⨯3 Matrix is represented as: Row 1: Txx Txy Txz, Row 2: Tyx Tyy Tyz, Row 3: Tzx Tzy Tzz. Note that Tij=Tji.

Parameter.Name: Electron Temperature Tensor, Error, DBCS
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron temperature tensor error during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: The Error can be applied to Data expressed by using either DBCS or GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Electron Heat Flux Vector, DBCS
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron heat-flux vector in DBCS during this survey

Parameter.Name: Electron Heat Flux Vector, GSE
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron heat-flux vector in GSE during this survey

Parameter.Name: Electron Heat Flux Error Vector
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron heat-flux error vector during this survey
Parameter.Caveats: The Error can be applied to Data expressed by using either DBCS or GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Pitch Angle, Alpha
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES fast survey sky-map pitch angles
Parameter.Caveats: Pitch Angles Angles used in Pitch Angle Spectrograms (Bent Pipe Field)

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Pitch Angle, Alpha, Delta Value
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES fast survey sky-map pitch angle deltas

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Energy
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES fast survey sky-map energies

Parameter.Name: Electron Sky Map Energy, Delta Value
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES fast survey sky-map delta energies
Parameter.Caveats: Note that the Deltas are provided to indicate that the FPI is reporting the Energy Bin Centers. The Deltas do not necessarily reflect the Energy Bandwidth that is sampled by the FPI for a given Energy Step.

Parameter.Name: Electron Parallel Temperature
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron parallel temperature during this BP

Parameter.Name: Electron Perpendicular Temperature
Parameter.Description: MMS2 FPI/DES electron perpendicular temperature during this BP
